result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers was found guilty of Kidnapping/Carry w/o Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(a).
  • Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers was found guilty of 1st Deg. Sexual Assault-Use/Dang.Weapon, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the PSI report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Roberta E. and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 years with 186 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 20 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 10 years; pay costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 years with 186 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 20 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 10 years - concurrent with Count 1; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) sex offender treatment assessment; 4) comply with sex offender registery program; 5) no contact with Shelby L or her family.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 633
cf

At the hour of 2:38 p.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson returned a verdict as follows:

"We, the Jury, find the defendant, Jeffrey Evers, guilty of Kidnapping in manner and form as charged in Count 1 of the Information.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 14th day of August, 2014." 

"We, the Jury, find the defendant, Jeffrey Evers, not guilty of Armed Robbery near Oakland Gyros in Count 2 of the Information.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 13th day of August, 2014." 

"We, the Jury, find the defendant, Jeffrey Evers, not guilty of Armed Robbery near th U.S. gas station in Count 3 of the Information.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 14th day of August, 2014." 

"We, the Jury, find the defendant, Jeffrey Evers, guilty of of First Degree Sexual Assault in manner and form as charged in Count 4 of the Information.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 13th day of August, 2014." 

Court polls the jury.  State moves for judgment on each of the four verdicts.  Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding on Counts 1 & 4  of the verdicts.  Court grants State's motion and orders judgments of convictions be entered on the record in Counts 1 & 4 and judgments of acquittals entered on Counts 2 & 3.

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order for Presentence Investigation received and filed.

Court orders defendant REMANDED into the custody of the sheriff.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case called at 10:25 a.m.   Court addresses five jury questions.   Jury in the box at 11:41 a.m.  Court releases the jury for lunch.  Jury out of the box at 11:45 a.m.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.

Case called at 3:15 p.m  Court addresses a jury question.   Jury in the box at 3:25 p.m.  Court plays Exhibit #5 for the jury.  Court reads the Allen Instruction to the jury.  Jury out of the box at 3:30 p.m.  Jury in the box at 4:40 p.m.  Court adjourns case to 8-14-14 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:43 p.m.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Jury in the box at 8:42 a.m.  Court charges the jury.  Alternate juror is chosen by lot.  At the hour of 8:48 a.m., the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Deputy Sheriffs Tracy Boone and Robert Pekar who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Case recalled at 10:26 a.m.  Same appearances. 

Court addresses a jury question.  Jury in the box at 11:14 a.m.   Court replays Exhibit #7 for the jury.   Jury out of the box at 11:24 a.m.  Jury in the box at 11:45 a.m.  Court releases the jury for lunch.  Jury out of the box at 11:49 p.m.

Jury in the box at 1:39 p.m.  Testimony of Detective Kurowski continues; Exhibit #13, 7 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence; Exhibit #14 marked, identified, offered into evidence.  Defense objects.  Court does not enter Exhibit #14 at this time.  Testimony of Detective Kurowski continues; Exhibit #14 offered and received into evidence.  Exhibit #11 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.  Stipulation read to the jury by the State.  Swor-in for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Karla Lehmann.  State rests.  Jury out of the box at 2:57 p.m.  Defense moves to dismiss without arguments.  State argues motion.  Court denies motion.  Court advises the defendant on right to testify.  Court finds the defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to testify.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury in the box at 3:28 p.m.  Court instructs the jury.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court charges the jury.  Court adjourns case to 8-13-14 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:28 p.m.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Jury in the box at 9:13 a.m.  Testimony of Shelby L. continues; Carl S.  Jury out of the box at 9:47 a.m.  Jury in the box at 10:14 a.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Katherine O'Keefe; Exhibit #9, 10 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 10:44 a.m.  Jury in the box at 11:08 a.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Diana C.; Exhibit #8 offered and received into evidence; Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Kurowski; Exhibit #12 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 11:57 p.m.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.

Jury in the box at 1:54 p.m.   Jury out of the box at 2:08 p.m.  Jury list received, filed and sealed.   Defense asks State for a reason as to a strike of an African-American juror.  Statements by the State.  Court finds there was no purposeful discrimination by the State and denies defense motion.  Jury in the box at 2:20 p.m.  Jurors sworn-in.  Court gives the jury preliminary instructions.  Opening statements by counsel.  Sworn-in for the State: Shelby L.; Exhibit #1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6  marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 3:36 p.m.  Jury in the box at 4:01 p.m.  Testimony of Shelby L. continues.  Jury out of the box at 4:10 p.m.  Jury in the box at 4:25 p.m.  Testimony of Shelby L. continues;  Exhibit #8 marked, identified.  Jury out of the box at 4:35 p.m.  Jury in the box at 4:44 p.m.  Testimony of Shelby L. continues.  Court adjourns case to 8-12-14 at 8:40 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:50 p.m.

Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial.  Parties impanel a jury of 13 good and lawful citizens of Milwaukee County.  Voire Dire:  11:05 a.m.  Court releases the jury for lunch.  Jury out of the box at 11:53 a.m.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court rules on motions in limine.   Court reviews defendant's prior convictions.   On motion of the defense, Court orders witnesses sequestered.  Stipulation received and filed.  Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely and voluntarily entering into the stipulation and waives right to have State proove the facts of the stipulation.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
-From Attorney Thomas J. Erickson on behalf of the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers not in court, in custody.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk'ds

Final pretrial held in chambers.  Case remains set for jury trial.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed./ds

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense counsel has recently been appointed.   Defense needs to obtain discovery from prior counsel.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room 506 of the Safety Building.   Case set for final pretrial on 8/4/2014 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 8/11/2014 at 9:00am.  Scheduling order signed and filed.   Case is adjourned to Br 44.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher A Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.    Attorney Opland-Dobs informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Discussion regarding the defendants request for a speedy trial demand.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Court vacated the jury trial date of 5/27/2014.  Court found cause to adjourned the speedy trial date.  Attorney Opland-Dobs will provide new appointed counsel with discovery.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 05-16-2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Expert and Summary of Expert Testimony and Witness List received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Motion to Withdraw received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher A. Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is scheduled for Bail/Bond Hearing. 
Defense requests bail be lowered. Arguments heard by the State. Court ordered bail increased from $10,000 to $50,000. Turn over to Justice Point for GPS monitoring with the following conditions:
Drug Testing, Breathalyzer Tests, Absolute Sobriety, No Contact with victim, and Absolutely no release from home (24 hour curfew). 
Case adjourned to Br. 12. 
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jeffrey Fitzgerald Evers in custody.  Christopher A. Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Karla Lehmann-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
